title: Indian Student Self-Deports After US Revokes Visa For "Supporting" Hamas
content: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem posted a video of Ranjani Srinivasan at the airport and said that anyone "advocating for violence and terrorism should not be in the country".

title: Death From Above: US Missile Strike Wipes Out ISIS Chief Of Global Ops
content: The United States, in coordination with Iraqi Intelligence and Security Forces, announced the killing of Abdallah Makki Muslih al-Rifai, also known as "Abu Khadijah," in a precision airstrike in Iraq's Al Anbar Province.

title: "Not Drunk, Airbags Blocked View": Law Student After Gujarat Crash Kills 1
content: The man, whose car rammed into nearby vehicles and passersby causing the death of one person and injuring several others in Vadodara, told the police that he could not see the road as airbags had deployed inside the vehicle.

title: After Trump Request, Putin Says He Will "Spare" Ukraine Troops If They...
content: President Vladimir Putin called on Friday for beleaguered Ukrainian troops in the Russian region of Kursk to "surrender" as Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky accused the Russian leader of seeking to sabotage a ceasefire initiative.

title: Sunita Williams Closer To Homecoming, NASA, SpaceX Launch Crew-10 Mission
content: The NASA and billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX on Friday (local time) launched the Crew-10 mission to bring back stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.

title: "Bengaluru MLAs Blackmailing Us": DK Shivakumar On Garbage Crisis
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Friday alleged that the city MLAs across political parties are "blackmailing" the government over Bengaluru's garbage crisis.

title: 'They Dub Tamil Films In Hindi': Pawan Kalyan Jabs DMK Amid Language Row
content: Janasena Party chief and Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan on Friday emphasised the need to preserve India's linguistic diversity, saying that the country "needs multiple languages, including Tamil, not just two."

title: Who Is Ranjani Srinivasan, Indian Self-Deported From US After Visa Revoked
content: Ranjani Srinivasan is a doctoral student in urban planning from Columbia University's Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation.

title: Pakistan, Bhutan Among 41 Countries In Trump's Potential Travel Ban List
content: The memo lists a total of 41 countries divided into three separate groups. The first group of 10 countries, including Afghanistan, Iran, Syria, Cuba and North Korea among others, would be set for a full visa suspension.

title: US Influencer "Truly Sorry" For Wombat Video, Slams Australian PM
content: US influencer Sam Jones said she intended to "prevent these amazing animals from being hit, and making sure the joey wasn't in need of immediate care."

title: "Race-Baiting...": US Expels South African Envoy, Says He 'Hates Trump'
content: The expulsion of the ambassador -- a very rare move by the United States -- is the latest development in rising tensions between Washington and Pretoria.

title: Rohit's Captaincy Call Already Taken By BCCI Before England Tests? "He Has..."
content: Rohit Sharma is likely to remain captain for the upcoming Test series against England after India's brilliant victory at the Champions Trophy 2025.

title: Not Rohit Or Kohli, Ponting Says India Outstanding At CT "Because They..."
content: With three all-rounders starting in their playing XI in all five of their games at the recently concluded Champions Trophy, India flexed an incredible batting depth,

title: Chilling Prediction Made By 'New Nostradamus' With India Link Comes True
content: Craig Hamilton-Parker is renowned for using Nadi astrology, a prophecy method with roots in ancient India to predict major global events.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Source: Kupp to join Seahawks on 3-year deal
content: Wide receiver Cooper Kupp has reached agreement on a three-year, $45 million contract with the Seahawks, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Friday.

title: Sources: NBA looking into OKC sitting 5 starters
content: The NBA is investigating a March 7 game in which the Thunder rested starters Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jalen Williams, Chet Holmgren, Luguentz Dort and Isaiah Hartenstein as well as Cason Wallace.

title: Sankey: Record 14 NCAA bids 'justified' for SEC
content: SEC commissioner Greg Sankey says his league has been "incomparable" this season and expects no less than a record 14 teams to make the men's NCAA tournament.

title: UNC refuses to blame lane violation for costly loss
content: The prevailing mantra in the aftermath of UNC's emotional loss to Duke: The Tar Heels had done enough to lose long before a costly lane violation with 4.1 seconds left, and yet this was still a team more than deserving of a spot in the NCAA tournament.

title: Cavs win franchise-best 16th straight, top Grizz
content: Evan Mobley had 22 points, Darius Garland added 20 and the Cavaliers recorded a franchise-record 16th straight victory with a 133-124 win over the Grizzlies on Friday night.

title: UConn-Creighton ends in scuffle over 'fancy' dunk
content: A scuffle broke out at the end of Creighton's victory over UConn in the Big East tournament semifinals Friday night after Jamiya Neal threw down a needless dunk for the Bluejays in the final seconds.

title: Thomas ties TPC record after 16-shot turnaround
content: Despite a bogey on 18, Justin Thomas fired a jaw-dropping 62 that tied the TPC Sawgrass record (Tom Hoge, 2023) and gave him a whopping 16-shot improvement over Thursday's 78.

title: Chargers bolster OL, agree to deal with Becton
content: The Chargers agreed to a two-year deal with guard Mekhi Becton on Friday, perhaps the team's most important signing of free agency.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ivy remains three-bid league as Princeton edges Virginia Tech for final spot on bubble
content: Princeton lost in the Ivy semifinals Friday, but played well enough to become the "Last Team In" the field. Virginia Tech remains "First Team Out."

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: Inside the Sabres' never-ending rebuild -- and how they get back to the playoffs
content: From Ryan O'Reilly to Jack Eichel to Sam Reinhart and more, success follows for a player once he leaves, with Buffalo set to miss the playoffs again.

title: 'You don't hang banners for milestones': Tom Izzo adapts and takes aim at another title
content: Izzo is surpassing milestones and reached a big anniversary of his lone title. At 70, with a highly ranked team, he's hoping to add to his legacy.

title: Cooper Flagg injury impact: Duke isn't 'Final Four good' without him, more reactions
content: How could Flagg's and Maliq Brown's potential absences impact the Blue Devils on the court -- and on Selection Sunday?

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: NWSL's BOS Nation to be renamed after backlash
content: Boston's 2026 NWSL franchise announced Friday that it will officially change its name following a highly-ridiculed launch last fall.

title: Estadio Azteca changes name ahead of 2026 WC
content: Mexico City's Estadio Azteca has changed its name to Estadio Banorte in order to help fund the final stages of remodeling for the upcoming 2026 World Cup.

title: Neymar ruled out of Brazil return, Endrick in
content: Neymar's return to action for Brazil will be delayed yet longer after the forward was ruled out of his country's squad for upcoming World Cup qualifiers on Friday due to a thigh injury.

title: Pride open season with 6-0 rout; Rodman returns
content: The reigning champion Orlando Pride opened the National Women's Soccer League season on Friday night with a 6-0 home field rout over the Chicago Stars.

title: Guardiola laughs off Capello calling him 'arrogant'
content: Pep Guardiola has laughed off criticism from Fabio Capello after the former England manager accused the Manchester City boss of ruining Italian football.

title: USMNT, Seattle winger Arriola suffers torn ACL
content: USMNT winger Paul Arriola suffered a torn ACL in the Seattle Sounders' Concacaf Champions Cup loss at Cruz Azul on Tuesday, the MLS club has confirmed.

title: Rashford returns in Tuchel's first England squad
content: Thomas Tuchel has handed Marcus Rashford a shock recall in his first England squad, which also includes call-ups for Myles Lewis-Skelly, Dominic Solanke and Dan Burn.

title: Atleti's Gallagher: Focus now on beating Barça
content: Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher said the team has moved on from the painful UEFA Champions League exit against Real Madrid in a controversial penalty shootout on Wednesday.

title: 75 years of innovation: How F1 has evolved since 1950 and where it's headed
content: To celebrate F1's 75th anniversary, ESPN charts the sport's evolution since 1950 through its most iconic cars, and details where it's headed in 2026.

title: If Hamilton is in F1 title fight, Leclerc expects to be, too
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari has dominated headlines, but Charles Leclerc is ready for a big year.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Kolo Muani as replacement for Isak
content: Newcastle are interested in Juventus striker Randal Kolo Muani, but could face competition from other Premier League clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Jason Sudeikis confirms 'Ted Lasso' Season 4, teases new team
content: Sudeikis said on the "New Heights" podcast that Lasso would be coaching a women's team in the new season.

title: Indian scholar self-deports after US revokes visa for being 'terrorist sympathiser'
content: Columbia University's Ranjani Srinivasan self-deported after the US revoked her student visa for alleged pro-terrorist activities. Homeland officials cited her participation in pro-Palestine protests. No direct evidence of her supporting terrorism was provided. Authorities are prioritizing national security amid rising tensions over immigration policies.

title: 'Had unexploded suicide vest on': Video shows US missile strike on ISIS leader
content: US Central Command, in coordination with Iraqi Intelligence and Security Forces, conducted a precision airstrike that killed Abdallah Makki Muslih al-Rifai, also known as Abu Khadijah, the second-highest-ranking ISIS leader. The operation marks a significant blow to ISIS leadership and their global operations.

title: Acid attack in Telangana: Temple accountant suffers burn injuries on face
content: An accountant at a religious site in Hyderabad sustained burn injuries after an unknown assailant threw acid on him. The attacker approached the victim, Narsing Rao, and poured the acid before fleeing on a bike. Security has been heightened following the incident.

title: 'Happy 4': Wife Sanjana pens heartfelt lyrics for Bumrah on anniversary
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Sanjana Ganesan celebrated their fourth anniversary, sharing heartfelt messages. Bumrah's continued recovery from a back injury has kept him off the field, impacting the Indian team's campaigns. His return remains uncertain as he works on regaining fitness for upcoming matches, with Mumbai Indians hopeful for his participation in IPL 2025.

title: Violence in WB's Birbhum: Security force deployed, internet suspended
content: Internet and voice-over-Internet telephony services have been suspended in five Gram Panchayat regions near Sainthia town, Birbhum district, West Bengal, from March 14 to March 17. This decision aims to curb rumour-mongering and illegal activities, amid recent stone-pelting incidents. Voice calls and SMS remain unaffected, ensuring ongoing communication through traditional means.

title: Elon Musk claims Soros, Hoffman fund Tesla protests; Fortnite CEO agrees
content: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney supports Elon Musk's claim that protests against Tesla are funded by billionaire donors like George Soros and Reid Hoffman. Sweeney relates this to his experience with Big Tech companies allegedly engaging in deceptive practices to smear his company.

title: 'Fanatical mindset': India slams Pakistan in UN over 'unjustified' reference to J&K
content: India strongly objected to Pakistan's mention of Jammu and Kashmir at the UN General Assembly, emphasizing that such references do not substantiate territorial claims. India highlighted Pakistan's history of cross-border terrorism and bigotry, asserting Jammu and Kashmir as an integral part of India.

title: Trump admin mulls travel restrictions on 43 nations; Pak, Iran on list: Report
content: According to the report, the countries have been divided into three groups of 11, 10 and 22, respectively. The first group is reportedly called the 'red list,' the second group is called 'orange list,' while the third one has been named 'yellow list.'

title: Vadodara car crash accused blames pothole, denies drunk driving
content: Rakshit Ravish Chaurasia, a 23-year-old law student, denied being drunk during a car accident in Vadodara that killed a woman and injured four others. He claimed the accident occurred after his car's airbags deployed suddenly. CCTV footage captured the incident, and Chaurasia has been arrested and booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, addressed the hype around AI in India, stating that many systems are just traditional programming. He emphasized that genuine AI involves machine learning and deep learning, which can greatly enhance human-like capabilities.

title: IPL 2025: Jasprit Bumrah likely to miss start of season
content: Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss the start of IPL 2025 due to a back injury he has been recovering from since January. The pacer has not set a definitive return date. In his absence, Mumbai Indians must rely on other bowlers for their initial matches. Sanju Samson and Mayank Yadav's fitness is also being assessed.

title: 'I received threat calls - 'Don't come to India'': Varun Chakaravarthy
content: Varun Chakravarthy emerged as a key player for India in the Champions Trophy, despite earlier setbacks and criticism after the 2021 T20 World Cup. Overcoming depression and threats, his performance boosted his confidence, making him a go-to bowler. With IPL 2025 approaching, he aims to maintain his momentum, showcasing resilience and preparation.

title: Pak International Airlines flight lands in Lahore with a missing wheel
content: A Pakistan International Airlines flight from Karachi to Lahore landed with one of its rear wheel missing, which was discovered upon arrival, after the flight a normal landing. Officials are investigating whether the wheel was lost during take-off or was already missing. The PIA spokesperson assured passenger safety and mentioned that a detailed investigation is in progress.

title: 'The Wolf of Wall Street' calls Elon Musk a Hero; dismisses US recession fears
content: Jordan Belfort praised Elon Musk as a "Hero" on Fox News and promised to buy a Tesla. He defended Trump's economic policies, reciprocal tariffs, and criticized Trump's detractors. Belfort reassured minimal impact on Americans from the trade war and applauded Trump's measures against spending, waste, and fraud.

title: Sunita Williams’ 9-month space mission nears end with ISS crew swap and Falcon 9 landing
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are set to return to Earth after an extended nine-month mission aboard the ISS, facilitated by the successful launch of SpaceX Crew-10. Originally part of a shorter Boeing Starliner test flight, their return was delayed due to technical issues. The Crew-10 mission ensures their smooth transition and highlights key developments in space exploration.

title: 'Abused, issued death threats': Video shows doctor attacking her elderly in-laws
content: A video of Dr Priyadarshini and her children allegedly assaulting her in-laws over a marital dispute went viral, causing public outrage. The incident was reported to the Annapoorneshwarinagar police, who have filed a case against her. The family dispute dates back years, and accusations from both sides are being investigated. The elderly couple claimed abuse and threats from Priyadarshini.

title: 'Some MLAs blackmailing us over garbage issue': Karnataka deputy CM Shivakumar
content: Deputy Chief Minister Shivakumar halted his morning routine to address Bengaluru's garbage crisis, which escalated as Mitaganahalli-Kannuru residents blocked garbage trucks. He described the issue as driven by a 'big mafia' and emphasized the need for cooperation among political parties to manage waste effectively on the city's outskirts.

title: Man tries to take a 'hot-pot' at the Yellowstone National Park, dies
content: Yellowstone National Park, renowned for its geothermal features, poses severe dangers in restricted areas. The tragic death of Colin Scott, who fell into a boiling acidic hot spring while filming, underscores the lethal risks of ignoring warnings. Despite posted signs, some visitors venture off trails, risking severe injuries or fatalities. Authorities urge adherence to the park's safety guidelines.

title: Woman dies during MRI scan as husband holds her to prevent movement; here's what went wrong
content: In Andhra Pradesh, a woman in her 60s tragically died during an MRI scan, with her family alleging negligence by hospital staff. The woman, undergoing dialysis treatment with a pacemaker, showed signs of distress during the scan but received no immediate help. The incident highlights the need for strict adherence to safety protocols for patients with implants and medical conditions.

title: 60-year-old duped of Rs 2.8 crore by brother using Chris Gayle’s name
content: A 60-year-old businesswoman was deceived into investing 2.8 crore in a sham coffee powder company, persuaded by her brother with promises of high returns. Trusting the alleged involvement of cricketer Chris Gayle, she and others suffered significant financial losses, receiving only 90 lakh out of the 5.7 crore investment.

title: Warner casts doubt on Bazball: 'I can’t see it ...'
content: David Warner doubts England's aggressive "Bazball" approach will succeed in Australia due to the challenging pitch conditions. While it earned praise for entertainment value, Warner believes it is high-risk on bouncier pitches. Warner, now playing for London Spirit in The Hundred, anticipates a mixed reception from fans but looks forward to competing again.

title: How Maharani Gayatri Devi turned a robbery into a lesson in grace and style
content: Maharani Gayatri Devi of Jaipur epitomized grace and style, particularly known for her iconic pearl necklaces and chiffon saris. Despite being looted at gunpoint in New York City, she humorously dismissed the incident. Pearls, especially the coveted Basra pearls, played a significant role in Indian royalty, symbolizing timeless elegance and sophistication.

title: Only 388 Indian illegals in US verified, all back: Govt
content: India has identified and returned 388 illegal immigrants from the US since President Trump's mass deportation campaign began. Verification of nationality is ongoing, and the Indian government emphasizes the need to address the illegal migration industry and take action against agents facilitating such activities. Last year, India accepted 1,368 deportees from the US.

title: Why all 50 Pakistan cricketers went unpicked in Hundred Draft
content: No Pakistani cricketers, including high-profile names like Naseem Shah and Shadab Khan, attracted bids during The Hundred Draft. Factors potentially contributing to this absence include the involvement of IPL team owners in The Hundred and the players' modest recent white-ball performances. Last year's issues with No Objection Certificates from the PCB may have also played a role.

title: PR Sreejesh: 'If we're speaking about 2036 Olympics ...'
content: Double Olympic medallist PR Sreejesh stresses the importance of grassroots investment and talent scouting to uplift India's sports future. He highlights exposure and mental preparation for Olympic success and urges talent identification at the nursery level. He advocates fostering a broader sports culture for overall health, with a focus on young athletes aged 12-14 for future Games.

title: 'Fugitive' ISIS leader in Iraq 'relentlessly hunted' and killed, says Trump
content: US President Donald Trump confirmed that ISIS leader in Iraq, Abu Khadija, was eliminated in a coordinated operation involving US, Iraqi, and Kurdish forces. Trump highlighted the operation as a significant blow to ISIS. The Iraqi leader praised the efforts that led to this crucial victory.

title: India files appeal in UK court to extradite arms agent Bhandari
content: The Indian government has requested the UK high court to certify two points of law for a Supreme Court appeal in the Sanjay Bhandari extradition case. Bhandari, accused of laundering money and evading taxes worth Rs 197 crore, allegedly did not declare Rs 731 crore in foreign assets on his Indian tax returns.

title: 'Chhaava' box office collection: Vicky Kaushal’s film earns Rs. 7.25 Cr on Holi
content: Vicky Kaushal's historical drama 'Chhaava' experienced a boost in its box office collection on its fifth Friday, recording Rs 7.25 Cr, after a slight dip in the third and fourth weeks. The film, which depicts the life of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, has amassed a total of Rs 546.75 Cr.

title: 'Happy Holi': Manu Bhaker, Neeraj Chopra celebrate in style
content: Manu Bhaker and Neeraj Chopra, prominent Indian athletes, celebrated Holi with fans through social media. Bhaker shared a festive photo comparison, while Chopra posted a creative javelin throw video. Their posts showcased their cultural appreciation alongside their sporting achievements, resonating with followers and highlighting the importance of balancing traditions with professional commitments.

title: British peers call for return of skulls, bones sourced illegally
content: UK peers urge the return of human remains displayed in British museums to their rightful communities and call for a sales ban on such items. The debate follows a controversy over a 19th-century Naga skull sale. British museums hold many ancestral remains acquired during the colonial era, often through violence. Culture minister expresses shock at online sales of these objects.

title: Woman dead, 4 hurt as student rams vehicle into 2-wheelers in Vadodara
content: A 23-year-old law student, Rakshit Chaurasia, allegedly in a drunken state, hit three vehicles, injuring eight and killing one in Vadodara. Chaurasia was driving while his friend Meet Chauhan owned the car. Chaurasia and Chauhan face charges, including culpable homicide. The deceased woman is identified as Hemali Patel, with her husband critically injured.

title: Tesla seeks certification for 2 EV models in India
content: Tesla has initiated the certification and homologation process for the Model Y and Model 3 in India as required to enter the market. The Indian EV market is growing, with sales increasing by 20%, due to government initiatives and subsidies.

title: 175 answersheets burnt in fire after teacher takes them home
content: A bundle of 175 HSC board answer sheets from a commerce exam was burnt when a teacher's house caught fire in Vasai on March 10. Neighbors extinguished the fire, but many of the papers were destroyed. An FIR has been filed against the teacher for carrying the papers home.

title: School head master does sit-ups to instil discipline among students
content: A headmaster in Vizianagaram's government school performed squats and prostrated before students during morning assembly, urging them to improve their discipline and academic performance. He expressed disappointment over their poor results and inattentiveness in class, appealing to parents to monitor their children's progress and behavior.

title: Train collides with truck at closed level crossing in Maharashtra's Jalgaon
content: An Amravati-bound train collided with a truck illegally crossing closed railway tracks in Jalgaon, Maharashtra. No injuries were reported, but the collision disrupted the schedules of five trains, including the Mumbai-Amravati Express. The incident caused significant damage to railway infrastructure. Repair work is underway, and legal action may be taken against the truck driver.

title: Indian leads study that could usher in diabetic astronauts
content: Research aimed at enabling insulin-dependent diabetic individuals to travel to space is a key task for India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla in the Axiom-4 mission. The project focuses on gathering and assessing accurate blood glucose data in orbit. Another focus is investigating microgravity effects and testing crop seeds' viability for future space missions.

title: Donald Trump's approval rating drops since election, Nate Silver explains why
content: Quinnipiac University's poll says Trump has a 42 per cent approval rating compared to a 53 per cent disapproval rating. The poll was taken from March 6-11, among 1,198 "self-identified registered voters." It has a margin of error of 2.8 per cent. A month before, Trump's disapproval rating was 49 per cent and approval rating was 45 per cent.

title: EA Sports FC 25 gets free version with the Legends Return update
content: free-to-play edition of the game is available on all platforms aside from Switch . kick off, Club Rush, and Learn To Play will be available as game modes featuring teams from Germany's Bundesliga and Frauen-Bundesliga . this first rotation will end on Apr. 2.

title: After PSG beat Liverpool, we ask: Is Dembélé the world's best?
content: ale Moreno says the departure of Kylian Mbappe has enabled Luis Enrique to turn PSG into a stronger team overall . he was an 18-year-old playing for Rennes and was on his way to scoring 12 goals and assisting five more in fewer than 2,000 minutes . "you also score with your right foot?" he asked .

title: ‘He was getting buckets’: Cooper Flagg always seemed inevitable
content: Cooper Flagg suffered a left ankle injury late in the first half of Duke's ACC Tournament quarterfinal game against Georgia Tech . the flag is pinned to the siding above the front door of Nemer's home alongside Sebasticook Lake . his facebook page is a shrine to Flagg, an endless scroll of highlights, stats and overt gushing that might seem like hyperbole if directed at anyone other than college basketball's biggest star .

title: Liverpool's Slot looks to follow Klopp, Newcastle chase history
content: arne slot's side are 15 points clear at the top of the table with nine games left to play . the reds are closing on what would be only a second league title since 1990 . a penalty shootout win over liverpool puts the club 15 points ahead of the quarterfinals .

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: the two-time pro bowler revealed he's engaged to R&B star Normani . the couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by singer Ciara . he joined fifth Harmony, a girl group formed from solo contestants .

title: How Chelsea Gray and Angel Reese powered the Rose to the semifinals
content: the last five seconds of the first half of unrivaled's final regular-season game between Rose BC and Vinyl counted down . the rose is called Point Gawd for a reason  10 points, 4 rebounds, and 4 assists at half pic.twitter.com/Mnu78ntRL1 .

title: How the sporting goods industry is bracing for tariffs
content: the talk of steep new taxes on imported products has created a flurry of questions for the sporting goods industry . in response to Trump imposing 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum, Canada will place 25% reciprocal tariffs . a new trade war will raise prices on a variety of consumer goods .

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: Power Rankings: Capitals back at No. 1, plus each team's playoff scoring leaders
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday, which generates our master list . the top career playoff scorers for each of the league's teams are ranked by the NHL's official records site .

title: No 'trust the process'? What's next for the Phoenix Suns
content: Kevin Durant helps the Suns erase a 23-point deficit en route to defeating the Clippers . the suns had given up 41 points in the second quarter and trailed by 19 entering the fourth . Durant later downplayed his first-quarter sideline clash with coach Mike Budenholzer .

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of Wednesday . the new league year was the start of the new season . a number of players have already signed with the seahawks .

title: Men's Bracketology: UNC is still in, plus more updates from a busy Friday
content: we track every result, day and night, ranking and reranking what will eventually constitute the NCAA tournament's field of 68 . it's going to be a weekend-long debate: North Carolina, with good metrics and few quality wins, versus Texas . the debate could also be rendered moot if a team such as Memphis, VCU or UC San Diego is to lose between now and Sunday night .

title: JD Vance's joke on wife Usha backfires as social media users suggest: 'Usha, run'
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Watch: SpaceX, Nasa launch mission to bring back Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read More 8 things parents should teach their child before they turn 13 Disha Patani mesmerises with effortless style and cool vibes .

title: Explosion outside Thakur Dwara temple in Amritsar
content: While no one was hurt in the incident, it has caused panic among the residents in the Khandwala area of Amritsar.

title: Religious discrimination affects followers of all faiths: India in UNGA
content: India’s Permanent Representative to the U.N. Ambassador P. Harish was addressing the informal meeting of the plenary in the General Assembly to commemorate the International Day to Combat Islamophobia

title: Agriculture Budget: T.N. to implement Hill Farmers Development Scheme for cultivation of minor millets
content: “The scheme will include cultivation of minor millets, distribution of inputs, area expansion in vegetable crops, farm machineries, value addition, and Micro Irrigation and Integrated Farming System,” said Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam

title: Militant arrested from Manipur's Kakching district
content: The member of the outlawed People's Liberation Army was apprehended from Langmeidong Mamang Leikai in Kakching

title: Haryana BJP leader shot dead in Sonipat over land dispute
content: The deceased has been identified as Surendra Jawahar, president of BJP's Mundlana Mandal in Sonipat, officials said

title: Man arrested in Kochi with meth, ganja
content: Arrest was part of intensified action by Kochi City police as part of D-Hunt, Kerala Police’s ongoing special drive against drugs

title: Agriculture Budget: T.N. announces missions to increase oilseeds and millet production
content: Presenting the Agriculture Budget for 2025, Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam said the Tamil Nadu Oil Seed Mission would be implemented at a cost of ₹108.06 crore to achieve self-sufficiency

title: Kalamassery polytechnic men’s hostel to come under CCTV coverage from next academic year
content: Move comes in the wake of seizure of nearly 2 kg of ganja from two rooms of the hostel during police raid and arrest of three final-year students

title: Why shouldn’t political parties pay rent for holding public meetings to police for providing security, asks HC judge
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan says when parties spend money for erecting stages and making seating arrangements, then they should also be ready to pay costs to State authorities

title: Narrow escape for Rakesh Tikait as car collides with nilgai in UP's Muzaffarnagar
content: Mr. Tikait said the accident took place when his vehicle was near the Meerpur bypass road in Muzaffarnagar

title: Pakistan blames India again for Baloch terror attacks
content: 8 things parents should teach their child before they turn 13 Disha Patani mesmerises with effortless style and cool vibes 8 purple coloured foods and their benefits Who is Ranya Rao? All you need to know about 'Wagah' actress Rasha Thadani slays Parisian street style with a power-chic look Priyanka Sarkar stunning elegance complements her natural beauty Subhashree Ganguly graceful charm enhances her radiant beauty Nimbu paani benefits: 8 surprising benefits of drinking lemon water once a day​ 12 foods one should avoid reheating in microwave and why

title: Mark Carney formally sworn in as Canada PM, replacing Trudeau
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world and deliver a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Gene Hackman’s will excludes children, now his $80m fortune hangs in the balance
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Hyderabad: 3,500-year-old Mudumal menhirs make it to Unesco tentative list
content: Syed Akbar is a senior journalist from Hyderabad. He is a specialist-journalist in science, technology, health, politics, environment, development, wildlife, religion, communities, and consumer affairs. He has been in the profession for the last 24 years. Before joining The Times of India, he worked with Deccan Chronicle and Indian Express. title: Agriculture Budget: DMK govt.’s initiatives helped T.N. expand area of cultivation, says Minister
content: Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam announced the creation of Uzhavar Nala Maiyam, or Farmers’ Welfare Centre, in 1,000 places

title: Ganja seizure at polytechnic hostel: Police take two former students of Kalamassery college into custody
content: Suspected to be dropouts, police suspect the duo to be behind supply of ganja seized from Government Polytechnic College, Kalamassery

title: Prepaid smart meters: KSEB again seeks Centre’s nod for grant for CAPEX mode roll-out
content: The Centre, however, is yet to give any assurance to the State government in this regard, according to Power department

title: Centre should release MGNREGA funds to West Bengal, says Parliamentary Standing Committee
content: Funds to the MGNREGA have been stalled for the past three years since March 2022, after the Centre invoked Section 27 of the MGNREGA 2005 which allows for stoppage of funds for violation of rules in implementation of the scheme by the State

title: Clashes erupt, vehicles torched during Holi procession in Jharkhand’s Giridih
content: The incident occurred when a Holi procession was passing through a street near the Ghodthambha Chowk in Giridih

title: India slams Pakistan for ‘unjustified’ reference to J&K in UNGA
content: India’s Representative in U.N. Harish said frequent references by Pakistan will “neither validate their claim nor justify their practice of cross-border terrorism”

title: Who is Ranjani Srinivasan, the Indian student at Columbia University who self-deported after visa revocation?
content: The Trump administration revoked the visa of Ranjani Srinivasan, an Indian citizen and doctoral student, “for advocating for violence and terrorism”

title: Mecca Masjid: a socio-political, religious and anti-colonial sanctuary
content: The masjid that played a pivotal role as a platform advocating the country’s freedom from British colonial rule,  now remains a crucial space for affirming the political agency of Hyderabad’s Muslims

title: Demolitions for metro line to pick up pace in Old City post Ramzan
content: Some 80 properties have been lined for demolitions out of which 39 properties have been demolished and demolition of 41 more properties is in various stages of progress, also 1,100 properties in total have been identified for land acquisition and notifications were issued for about 980 by Hyderabad District Collector, Managing Director of Hyderabad Airport Metro Limited said

title: Child trafficking racket has its trail in other States as well, say police
content: The accused alleged trafficked infants from Delhi, Gujarat, Maharashtra and other States; teams would be sent to nab the accused, say police

title: Near historical Hampi, a heinous crime
content: On the night of March 6, Bibhas Nayak from Odisha was killed and two women — an Israeli tourist and an Indian homestay operator — were gang-raped by three men when they went stargazing at Sanapura lake near Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage site, in Karnataka. Kumar Buradikatti pieces together the crime that took place in a region that is generally considered safe

title: Mother tongue-based multilingual education to help tribal children bridge linguistic divide in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Mother Tongue-Based Multilingual Education programme is operational in 1454 schools in eight districts, covering six tribal languages of Savara, Sugali, Konda, Koya, Kuvi and Adivasi Oriya

title: A rally, some ruffled feathers, and the republic on the defensive as monarchy debate resurfaces in Nepal
content: On March 9, Gyanendra, who was dethroned in 2008, arrived in Kathmandu, sparking a rally calling for the monarchy’s return; the rally highlighted public frustration with the current republic system, reflecting dissatisfaction with political leaders who have failed to meet expectations; as monarchists call for the reinstatement of the institution, observers call for strengthening the republican system

title: BRS leaders lodge complaints in police stations against Telangana CM for ‘mortuary’ remarks
content: BRS leaders file complaints against CM Revanth Reddy for criminal comments, seek legal action and protection for KCR

title: Archie and friends learn about Holi in new edition of comic
content: The Holi celebration is part of a new 10-page Archie comic story in The World of Betty & Veronica digest #38 released Thursday (March 13, 2025)

title: Temple accountant attacked with acid by unidentified assailant
content: Police investigate acid attack on Pedda Thota Bhu Lakshmi Temple accountant; suspect unidentified, investigation ongoing

title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2025 caters to key sectors, core voter base
content: While the State’s overall debt burden is expected to rise to ₹9,29,959.3 crore, the Debt to GSDP ratio remains within the prescribed limits at 26.07%.

title: Tamil Nadu’s GST growth is better than national average: Finance Secretary
content: T. Udhayachandran says that a GST growth of 22% is one of the highest in the country, and asserts that the State is doing well in the GST and IGST settlements. Stressing the importance of international trade relations, he further says that the growth of any State is dictated by global trends

title: Some legislators ‘blackmailing’ govt. over dumping yards in their constituencies: Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: Garbage collection in parts of the city was affected following a protest by the residents of Kannur village panchayat, where the Mittaganagalli landfill is situated

title: Two Kerala students petition Karnataka Examinations Authority seeking rescheduling of CET
content: Common Entrance Test is scheduled to be held from April 16 to 18; they say the dates clash with Christian religious ceremonies

title: Park to conserve rare native flora species to come up near Chengam
content: The park will be set up on 1,000 hectares of forestland at Mel Chengam town, which comes under Chengam panchayat union; the park will be established at a cost of ₹10 crore.

title: India needs multi-languages, says Jana Sena supremo Pawan Kalyan
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM advocates for multiple languages, religious freedom, and ideological politics in India

title: Jayant Patil will leave NCP(SP) soon to join hands with Ajit Pawar, says Minister Sanjay Shirsat
content: The Shiv Sena leader has speculated that there ‘will be an earthquake’ in Sharad Pawar’s NCP(SP) soon when Jayant Patil joins the Ajit Pawar-led NCP

title: East Coast Road to get elevated corridor from Thiruvanmiyur to Uthandi
content: The project, which has been estimated to cost ₹2,100 crore, will be the first one to be undertaken by the newly formed Tamil Nadu State Highways Authority. The announcement was made as part of the State Budget 2025-26

title: Scientists from India, UK join hands to research healthy brain aging
content: The institutions in India and UK will harness the power of diverse population studies across India and the United Kingdom, combining unique research cohorts that span urban and rural communities

title: Youth killed in Titagarh amidst Holi celebrations
content: The police arrested Pawan Rajbhar, who was earlier jailed over another criminal case in the area, in connection with the murder

title: SHRC project to combat drug, digital addiction among children in two coastal villages
content: Project will be implemented among children in the 10-18 age group in five select schools in Anchuthengu and Maryanad

title: Amid tight security, Holi celebrations, Friday prayers conducted peacefully across U.P.
content: The Holi celebrations, much like the Maha Kumbh, have silenced those claiming that Sanatana Dharma divides people, says U.P. CM

title: ‘Appu’ re-release: Theatres witness festive atmosphere as fans cheer for Puneeth Rajkumar
content: ‘Appu’, the 2002 Kannada film directed by Puri Jagannadh, launched Puneeth Rajkumar as a hero in the Kannada film industry. The movie was re-released as a part of the actor’s 50th birth anniversary celebrations

title: India adds six properties to tentative list for UNESCO recognition
content: The 'tentative list' is an inventory of properties each country intends to consider for UNESCO nomination

title: Opposition picks up on govt. using SCSP/TSP money on guarantees
content: BJP calls it ‘misuse’ while the Congress insists that it is a ‘false narrative’ being built by the saffron party

title: Cocoa farmers staring at a crisis in A.P. as price plummets
content: Current domestic market prices are much below last year’s rates, but even at the reduced prices there are no takers, say ryots; seek govt. intervention to stabilise prices

title: Nurse’s murder in Haveri takes communal colour with the arrest of her boyfriend
content: Niyaz Bennigere called Swati Byadgi to talk her out of marriage and with the help of his friends, strangled her to death before throwing the body into the Tungabhadra

title: Hyderabad Holi 2025: Colours, beats & treats fill the streets
content: Children and youth were seen chasing each other with vibrant shades of yellow, blue, and green, turning the narrow lanes into a patchwork of colour.

title: Malankara Church discord widens further
content: Orthodox Syrian Church comes out against a call by Jacobite faction for coexistence like sister churches

title: Court rejects Ranya Rao’s bail plea, Gaurav Gupta Committee begins probe
content: DRI had objected to her bail plea arguing that the case possibly involved an international smuggling syndicate, which was yet to be completely unravelled, and Ranya Rao was not cooperating with the probe.

title: Former Congress MLA from Bilaspur shot at by unidentified people in Himachal Pradesh
content: Former MLA Bamber Thakur was sitting in the courtyard of the government accommodation allotted to his wife in Bilapsur along with others when four people came and opened fire

title: ED summons to Radhakrishnan signals resumption of ED-right wing media misinformation campaign against LDF: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) State Secretary M V Govindan says the agency has again borrowed a page from its tried and tested fake news playbook in a desperate bid to sway public opinion against the second Pinarayi Vijayan government in the politically sensitive run-up to the local body polls and the Assembly elections in 2026

title: Pemmasani and Lokesh participate in Mangalagiri temple ‘rathotsavam’
content: The streets of Mangalagiri turned into a sea of devotees as thousands flocked to witness the grand spectacle

title: Man launches attack with iron rod inside Golden Temple in Amritsar, injures 5
content: “There was a clash inside the Golden Temple premises, and people of both sides suffered injuries. The workers of SGPC have also been injured. Action will be taken according to law”, said police

title: Punjab: Shiv Sena leader shot dead, minor boy suffers bullet injuries
content: While police said the incident could be a fallout of a personal rivalry, the deceased's family said he did not have enmity with anyone

title: The manifold perils of stretching body out through sunroof
content: ”Many overlook the danger of standing through a sunroof, risking serious injury if brakes are suddenly applied”

title: Demolition of Tagore Hall in Kozhikode begins
content: The 51-year-old Tagore Centenary Hall, located in the heart of the city, is being demolished to make way for a proposed modern multipurpose complex.

title: State govt. must take responsibility for demolition of Kasinayana Jyothi Kshetram, says YSRCP leader
content: Malladi Vishnu accuses the ruling TDP government of playing politics with the Hindu sentiments while failing to provide genuine protection to religious sites

title: Real-money gaming firms flag spike in offshore betting apps
content: Real money gaming firms have argued that heavy taxation would lead to the proliferation of illegal offshore apps; with those fears now materialising, financial strain is leading to industry consolidation

title: Joy and fervour mark Holi celebrations in most North Karnataka towns, villages
content: In Belagavi, men and boys gather at Bhadkal Galli and enjoy rain dances and a musical performance by local musicians

title: None of the 1,275 gazetted posts filled in Ladakh in the past six years, govt. informs parliamentary panel
content: Of 3,596 vacancies in non-gazetted posts in the Union Territory, 3,172 have been filled through various agencies; a staff selection board has also been formed, Home Ministry tells a House panel

title: Pakistan International Airlines Flight Lands At Airport With A Missing Wheel
content: a PIA domestic flight landed on the lahore airport with one of its wheels missing . no untoward accident was reported due to the incident, an official says . the PK-306 made a "smooth and uneventful landing"
